info.title: SharePoint
info.description: SharePoint helps organizations share and collaborate with colleagues, partners, and customers. You can connect to SharePoint Online or to an on-premises SharePoint 2013 or 2016 farm using the On-Premises Data Gateway to manage documents and list items.

get.description:
Default - Only query current folder (non-recurisve). Return both Files and Folders.

get.description: Gets templates from a SharePoint document library.
Gets placeholders from template in a SharePoint document library.

post.description: Use this action to create documents based on modern templates from Microsoft Syntex. This preview requires a Syntex license. Pricing is subject to change. For more info see: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/contentunderstanding/content-assembly.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Must start with an existing library.

get.description: Gets image fields from a SharePoint list.
Returns file contents of the image in list item field.

schema.description: The contents of the image file.

X-MS-SPConnector-ResponseHasContent.description: Image is present in the field.

post.description: Sets or updates the image in list item field.

delete.description: Clears the image in list item field.

get.description: Gets information about the file such as size, etag, created date, etc. Uses a file identifier to pick the file. Use "Get file properties" action to get to the values stored in the columns in the library.

put.description: Updates the contents of the file specified by the file identifier.

delete.description: Deletes the file specified by the file identifier.

get.description: Gets information about the file such as size, etag, created date, etc. Uses a file path to pick the file. Use "Get file properties" action to get to the values stored in the columns in the library.
Gets information about the folder. Uses a file identifier to pick the folder.
Gets information about the folder. Uses a folder path to pick the folder.
Gets file contents using the file path.
Gets file contents using the file identifier. The contents can be copied somewhere else, or be used as an attachment.

post.description: Uploads a file to a SharePoint site. Make sure to pick an existing library.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Must start with an existing library. Add folders if needed.

parameters.name: uploadId
parameters.description: Id of upload session from SharePoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Id of upload session from SharePoint

post.description: Copies a file to a SharePoint site.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Whether or not to overwrite the destination file if it exists.

post.summary: For a Selected File Hybrid Trigger. The actual API is not called at runtime
post.description: For a Selected File Hybrid Trigger. The actual API is not called at runtime.

get.summary: When a file is created in a folder (deprecated)
get.description: Triggers when a file is created in a SharePoint folder. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.
get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add a file to the SharePoint folder you selected.

get.summary: When a file is created or modified in a folder (deprecated)
get.description: Triggers when a file is created, and also each time it is modified in a SharePoint folder. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

parameters.name: includeFileContent
parameters.description: If set to true, file content will also be retrieved along with the trigger response.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, modify a file in the SharePoint folder you selected.

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of files to return from the trigger

parameters.name: checkBothCreatedAndModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: If the flag is set to true, the trigger will check the file's created date and time and the file's last modified date and time. If the flag is set to false, the trigger will only check the file's last modified date and time.

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of files to return from the trigger

get.description: Returns files contained in a SharePoint folder.
Returns files in the root SharePoint folder.

post.description: Extracts an archive file into a SharePoint folder (example: .zip).

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Whether or not to overwrite the destination file if it exists.

get.description: Gets possible values for a SharePoint entity.
Returns a single matching user value so it can be assigned to a column of type person. If there are no matches, or multiple matches, this action will error out.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Pick the list or library that the column is in.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: Pick the column you want to assign the value to.

parameters.name: searchValue
parameters.description: Use the email address, or the full name of the user.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Avoid column threshold issues by only using columns defined in a view.

get.description: Returns User fields for a list.

parameters.description: Avoid column threshold issues by only using columns defined in a view.

get.summary: Check if the scheduled version of the item is published
get.description: Returns the result in the output variable IsFilePublished.

parameters.name: scheduledVersion
parameters.description: Version of file that was scheduled for publish.

post.description: Sets the content approval status for an item in a list or library that has content approval turned on. You must provide an ETag for pages and files. You can get the ETag using the Get File Metadata action. This action is only available for SharePoint Online and SharePoint 2019.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the item you are setting the status of.

parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Add the comments from the approver.

parameters.name: entityTag
parameters.description: Add an ETag (required for files and pages).

post.description:
Set the Sign-off status field in a list or library. This will work even if the file is locked.
            However, this will not update the Modified time and will not cause flows with the "when an item is created or modified" or "when a file is created or modified (properties only)" trigger to fire.
            If you need such a flow to fire, add an "Update Item" action after this action.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the item you are setting the status of.

post.description: Check out a file in a document library to prevent others from editing the document, and your changes from being visible until the documented is checked in.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the list item the file is attached to.

post.description: If you check out a file and don’t make changes to it, or you make changes that you don’t want to keep, you can simply discard the checkout, rather than saving the file. If your organization tracks versions, a new version is created each time you check a file back into the library. By discarding the checkout, you can avoid making new versions when you haven’t made any changes to the file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the list item the file is attached to.

post.description: Check in a checked out file in a document library, which makes the version of the document available to others.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the list item the file is attached to.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Parameters to this operation passed in the body.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Parameters to this operation passed in the body

get.description: Internal operation to get values for file check in type dropdown in check in file operation.

post.summary: Grant access to an item or a folder
post.description: Grant access to an item or a folder in SharePoint to specific people.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item or folder you want to grant access to.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Parameters to this operation passed in the body.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Parameters to this operation passed in the body

get.description: Internal operation to get access role options in grant access operations.

post.summary: Stop sharing an item or a file
post.description: Delete all links giving access to an item or a file and remove all people with direct access except for owners.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the item or file you want to stop sharing.

post.summary: Get changes for an item or a file (properties only)
post.description: Returns information about columns that have changed within a given time window. Note: The list must have Versioning turned on.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the item you want to fetch changes for.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Trigger Window Start token or an item version label (ex: 3.0) or an ISO 8601 date (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ).

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Trigger Window End token or an item version label (ex: 3.0) or an ISO 8601 date (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ). If blank, defaults to latest version.

parameters.name: includeDrafts
parameters.description: Boolean for whether to consider changes from minor (draft) versions.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Returns only columns defined in a view.

get.description: Returns the list of attachments for the specified list item. You can add a "Get attachment content" step and use the "File identifier" property returned by this action to get to the contents of the file.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: Id of the list item to get attachments from.

post.description: Adds a new attachment to the specified list item.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: Id of the list item to attach the file to.

get.description: Returns file contents using the file identifier. The contents can be copied somewhere else, or be used as an attachment.

parameters.description: Id of the list item the file is attached to.

post.description: Construct a SharePoint REST API to invoke. Note – This action may execute any SharePoint REST API you have access to. Please proceed with caution.

parameters.description: Parameters to this operation passed in the body.

post.description: Join the requested site to the hub site. An Approval Token is required to complete the join successfully if that hub requires approval. If applicable, you should specify the same Approval Correlation Id as used in the "Set hub site join status to pending" action.

parameters.name: approvalCorrelationId
parameters.description: Approval correlation identifier for this request.

post.summary: Set hub site join status to pending
post.description: Set the requested site's hub join request status to pending. The Approval Correlation Id is an optional parameter that helps SharePoint identify a particular hub join request. The requesting site can only have one pending request at a given time.

parameters.name: approvalCorrelationId
parameters.description: Approval correlation identifier for this request.

post.description: Cancel hub join request. If applicable, you should specify the same Approval Correlation Id as used in the "Set hub site join status to pending" action.

parameters.name: approvalCorrelationId
parameters.description: Approval correlation identifier for this request.

post.description: Approve hub site join request. This will return an approval token that can be used to complete the join request using the join hub site action.

get.summary: When a file is created (properties only)
get.description:
Triggers when an item is created in a library. Returns only the properties stored in the library columns.
            You can add a "Get file content" step and use the "File identifier" property returned by this action to get to the contents of the file.
            When using this with the On-Premises Data Gateway, the name of the library to connect to may need to be entered manually.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Select a folder, or leave blank for the whole library

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Avoid column threshold issues by only using columns defined in a view

get.description: Triggers when an item is deleted in a list. This can only be used by site collection admins of the site where the list is located.
Triggers when an item is deleted in a list. This can only be used by site collection admins of the site where the list is located.

Triggers when a file is deleted in a library. You can optionally specify a folder to watch as well. When a folder is deleted, the trigger will fire only once for the deleted folder. This can only be used by site collection admins of the site where the list is located.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Select a folder, or leave blank for the whole library

get.description: Triggers when a file is deleted in a library. You can optionally specify a folder to watch as well. When a folder is deleted, the trigger will fire only once for the deleted folder. This can only be used by site collection admins of the site where the list is located.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Select a folder, or leave blank for the whole library

parameters.description: An ODATA filter query to restrict the entries returned (e.g. stringColumn eq 'string' OR numberColumn lt 123).

parameters.description: Total number of entries to retrieve (default = all).

get.description:
Gets the properties saved in the columns in the library for all folders and files stored in the library.
            You can also filter down to the items that match a condition. An "Apply to each" section is usually used to work with the output from this action.
            When using this with the On-Premises Data Gateway, the name of the library to connect to may need to be entered manually.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An ODATA filter query to restrict the entries returned (e.g. stringColumn eq 'string' OR numberColumn lt 123).

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: An ODATA orderBy query for specifying the order of entries.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Total number of entries to retrieve (default = all).

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Select a folder, or leave blank for the whole library

parameters.name: viewScopeOption
parameters.description: Return entries contained in sub-folders (default = true)

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Avoid column threshold issues by only using columns defined in a view

grantedToIdentities.description: For link type permissions, the details of the users to whom permission was granted

roles.description: The type of permission - read, write, owner, member

PermissionIdentitySet.description: The IdentitySet resource is a keyed collection of identity resources

SharingLinkPermissionIdentitySet.description: The IdentitySet resource is a keyed collection of identity resources

SharingInvitation.description: The SharingInvitation resource groups invitation-related data items into a single structure

email.description: The email address provided for the recipient of the sharing invitation

signInRequired.description: If true the recipient of the invitation needs to sign in in order to access the shared item

ItemReference.description: The ItemReference resource provides information necessary to address a DriveItem via the API

name.description: The name of the parent item

path.description: Path that can be used to navigate to the parent item

ApplicationPermissionIdentity.description: The Identity resource represents an identity of an application

displayName.x-ms-summary: Permission - Granted To - Application Display Name

GroupPermissionIdentity.description: The Identity resource represents an identity of a group

displayName.x-ms-summary: Permission - Granted To - Group Display Name

UserPermissionIdentity.description: The Identity resource represents an identity of an user

displayName.x-ms-summary: Permission - Granted To - User Display Name

SharingLinkUserPermissionIdentity.description: The Identity resource represents an identity of an user

SharePointIds.description: The SharePointIds resource groups the various identifiers for an item stored in a SharePoint site or OneDrive for Business into a single structure

listId.description: The unique identifier (guid) for the item's list in SharePoint

listItemId.description: An integer identifier for the item within the containing list

listItemUniqueId.description: The unique identifier (guid) for the item within OneDrive for Business or a SharePoint site

siteId.description: The unique identifier (guid) for the item's site collection (SPSite)

siteUrl.description: The SharePoint URL for the site that contains the item

tenantId.description: The unique identifier (guid) for the tenancy

webId.description: The unique identifier (guid) for the item's site (SPWeb)

roles.description: Specify updated roles for this permission.

recipients.description: A collection of recipients who will receive access and the sharing invitation.

roles.description: Specify the roles that are be granted to the recipients of the sharing invitation.

requireSignIn.description: Specifies where the recipient of the invitation is required to sign-in to view the shared item.

sendInvitation.description: Specifies if an email or post is generated (true) or if the permission is just created (false).

message.description: A plain text formatted message that is included in the sharing invitation. Maximum length 2000 characters.

ItemPermissionRecipient.description: This resource represents a person, group, or other recipient to share with using the invite action.

email.description: The email address for the recipient, if the recipient has an associated email address.

type.description: The type of sharing link to create

scope.description: Choose who your sharing link gives access to. "Anyone" option will only work if your administrator has enabled it.

expirationDateTime.description: The date after which the link will expire in yyyy-MM-dd format. Only applicable for anonymous links.

Name.description: The name of the table. The name is used at runtime.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the table.

DynamicProperties.description: Additional table properties provided by the connector to the clients.

SPContentType.description: Output object of the GetDocumentSetContentTypesInLibrary endpoint on the SPO Connector shim

SPForASelectedFileResponse.description: For a selected file hybrid trigger response

CopyFileParameters.description: Body parameters for SharePoint copy file operation

nameConflictBehavior.description: Pick one of the options available
nameConflictBehavior.x-ms-summary: If another file is already there

SPBlobMetadataResponse.description: The SharePoint version of the BlobMetadataResponse extends the object by adding some additional fields that we want serialized

ItemId.description: The value that can be used to Get or Update file properties in libraries.

Id.description: The unique id of the file or folder.

Name.description: The name of the file or folder.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the file or folder.

Path.description: The path of the file or folder.

LastModified.description: The date and time the file or folder was last modified.

Size.description: The size of the file or folder.

MediaType.description: The media type of the file or folder.

IsFolder.description: A boolean value (true, false) to indicate whether or not the blob is a folder.

ETag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

FileLocator.description: The filelocator of the file or folder.

MoveFileParameters.description: Body parameters for SharePoint move file operation

nameConflictBehavior.description: Pick one of the options available
nameConflictBehavior.x-ms-summary: If another file is already there

CopyFolderParameters.description: Body parameters for SharePoint copy folder operation

nameConflictBehavior.description: Pick one of the options available
nameConflictBehavior.x-ms-summary: If another folder is already there

MoveFolderParameters.description: Body parameters for SharePoint move folder operation

nameConflictBehavior.description: Pick one of the options available
nameConflictBehavior.x-ms-summary: If another folder is already there

PatchFileItemWithPredictedValuesParamete.description: Body parameters for SharePoint PatchFileItemWithPredictedValues HttpRequest operation

modelId.description: Enter modelId of the Model which is used for prediction

PublishedResult.description: Output object of the CheckIfFileIsPublished endpoint on the SPO Connector shim

IsFilePublished.description: A boolean value (true, false) to indicate whether the scheduled version of the file has been published

ETag.description: ETag of the item after the approval status was set

ApprovalLink.description: A link to the item that needs approval

PublishStartDate.description: Date time at which the item will be Published

ContentApprovalStatus.description: The content approval status of the list item

ScheduledVersion.description: The version of the item that has been scheduled

CreateNewFolderParameters.description: Body parameters for SharePoint Create New Folder operation

FileCheckInParameters.description: Body parameters for SharePoint checkin file operation

comment.description: Type comments describing what has changed in this version

checkinType.description: Select the type of version you would like to check in

recipients.description: A collection of recipients who will receive the sharing invitation

roleValue.description: Specify a role that is to be granted to the recipients

emailBody.description: A plain text formatted message that is included in the sharing invitation

sendEmail.description: Specify whether recipients should receive an email notification message

serverPagingOptions.description: List of supported server-driven paging capabilities

sortable.description: Indicates whether this table has sortable columns

ascendingOnlyProperties.description: List of properties which support ascending order only

filterable.description: Indicates whether this table has filterable columns

selectable.description: Indicates whether this table has selectable columns

SharePointHttpRequestBodyParameters.description: Body parameters for SharePoint HttpRequest operation

headers.description: Enter JSON object of request headers

PassThroughNativeQuery.description: static schema for pass-through native query execution

DeletedItem.description: An item deleted from a SharePoint list or library

Name.description: File name of the item in document libraries, display name of the item in lists

FileNameWithExtension.description: File name with extension of the item in document libraries, same as Name of the item in lists

DeletedByUserName.description: The name of the user who deleted this item

IsFolder.description: A true/false value to indicate if the item is a folder
